Lack of evidence from reliable sources: The expert's verdict highlights that there is no evidence to support the claim that Bill O'Reilly wrote a post claiming that the coronavirus was created as a bioweapon by the Chinese government. The absence of any credible sources or news organizations reporting on such a post undermines the authenticity of the claim.
Debunked conspiracy theory: The claim promotes a widely debunked theory that the virus was created as a bioweapon in a Chinese lab. The expert's verdict emphasizes that this theory has been discredited by fact-checking organizations and lacks substantial evidence.
Misattribution and false authorship: The post falsely attributes the 1,338-word essay to Bill O'Reilly, a former Fox News host. However, investigations reveal that the true author of the essay appears to be a man named Tim Besmer, who posted it on his Facebook page. The misattribution of authorship further undermines the credibility of the claim.
Confirmation from O: Reilly's website staff: The staff of Bill O'Reilly's website confirmed that he did not write the message in question. This confirmation from a reliable source adds weight to the conclusion that the claim is not authentic.
